Articles.Content:
I decided to start my own munar program. Basically I want to recreate every Apollo Mission with my own equipment that will be heavily influenced by the real apollo equipment. After this is done we will see how far I can go with my apollo hardware. Right now the basic designs for the boosters are done.

* * *

![ASxEzWD.png](http://i.imgur.com/ASxEzWD.png)
* * *

**Kerbonaut Roster**

**Name/Occupation/Status/Missions**  

- Bill Kerman                     Engineer                 <font color="#00cc00">Active                 </font>ODIN 7-15, AG-2, OZTP
- Bob Kerman                   Scientist                  <font color="#3399ff">Retired               </font>ODIN 7-15, AG-2, OZTP
- Charles M. Kerman, Jr.  Scientist                  <font color="#00cc00">Active                 </font>ODIN 16, 18
- Eugene A. Kerman         Pilot                        <font color="#00cc00">Active</font>                 ODIN 17, AG-4
- Harrison H. Kerman       Scientist                  <font color="#00cc00">Active               </font>  ODIN 17, AG-4
- Jebdiah Kerman             Pilot                        <font color="#ff0066">Deceased        </font>  ODIN I
- John W. Kerman            Scientist                  <font color="#00cc00">Active               </font>  ODIN 16, AG-3
- Judith Kerman                Engineer                 <font color="#00cc00">Active                </font>AG-3, O18
- Ronald E. Kerman          Pilot                        <font color="#00cc00">Active                </font> ODIN 17, AG-4, O18
- Thomas K. Kerman, II    Pilot                        <font color="#3399ff">Retired               </font>ODIN 16, AG-3
- Valentina Kerman           Pilot                        <font color="#00cc00">Active               </font> ODIN 7-15, AG-2, OZTP, O19
- Sally Kerman                  Scientist                  <font color="#00cc00">Active</font>                Odin 19
- Kathryn Kerman             Engineer                 <font color="#00cc00">Active               </font> Odin 19

* * *

**Glossary**

Spoiler

- CDR - [Commander](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronaut_ranks_and_positions#Positions)
- CM - [Command Module](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Command/Service_Module#Command_Module_.28CM.29)
- CMP - [Command Module Pilot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronaut_ranks_and_positions#Positions)
- CSM - [Command and Service Module](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Command/Service_Module)
- EVA - [Extravehicular activity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extravehicular_activity)
- MEM - [Munar Excursion Module](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Lunar_Module)
- MMP - [Munar Excursion Module Pilot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astronaut_ranks_and_positions#Positions)
- MOI - [munar orbit insertion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbit_insertion)
- MRV - [Munar Roving Vehicle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lunar_Roving_Vehicle)
- OMSEP - [Odin Munar Surface Experiment Package](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Lunar_Surface_Experiments_Package)
- OTM - [Odin Telescope Mount](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Telescope_Mount)
- S-IB - [First stage of the Slepinir I and IB booster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-IB)
- S-IC - [First stage of the Sleipnir V booster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-IC)
- S-II - [Second stage of the Sleipnir V booster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-II)
- S-IV - [Second stage of the Sleipnir I booster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-IV)
- S-IVB - [third stage of the Sleipnir V and second stage of the Sleipnir IB booster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S-IVB)
- SM - [Service Module](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Command/Service_Module#Service_Module_.28SM.29)
- SPS - [Service Propulsion System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_Command/Service_Module#Service_Propulsion_System)
- TKI - [trans-kerbular injection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trans-Earth_injection)
- TMI - [trans-munar injection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trans-lunar_injection)

* * *

**Hardware:**

Spoiler

![D64AobK.png](http://i.imgur.com/D64AobK.png)

> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 

The Sleipnir I comes in two flavors: Sleipnir I and Sleipnir IB, the main difference beeing the uprated second stage.

![w0uJIGJ.png](http://i.imgur.com/w0uJIGJ.png)

> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 

The Sleipnir V is the main workhorse of the Odin program. It is able to launch the CSM and MEM together and boost them to the mun

![kdZY6Ud.png](http://i.imgur.com/kdZY6Ud.png)

> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 

The Sleipnir MLV is a hypothetical upgrade to the Sleipnir V that only exists on the drawing board right now

![j6U6buV.png](http://i.imgur.com/j6U6buV.png)

> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 

The Munin II is a cheap rocket, built specifically to test the Odin launch escape system.

![wrFk8RL.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/wrFk8RL.png?1)

> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 

We have just procured our newest rocket: the [Naglfar-Logi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlas-Centaur)

The first stage of this new rocket is a modification of the old [Naglfar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SM-65_Atlas) ICBM. However, this old workhorse will from now on pull the chariot of science! Outfittet with the new Logi Second stage it becomes a top of the line two-and-a-half stages expendable launch system, that can be used to send satellites into orbit or probes to the mun.

* * *

**Missions:**

- [Sleipnir I OS-1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2080935)- Test of the S-IB first stage (see: [Saturn I SA-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-1))
- [Sleipnir I OS-2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2080935) - Second test of the S-IB first stage (see: [Saturn I SA-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-2))
- [Sleipnir I OS-3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2081701) - Third test of the S-IB first stage (see: [Saturn I SA-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-3))
- [Sleipnir I OS-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2082480) - Fourth and last single stage test. How does the booster react if it drops one engine? (see: [Saturn I SA-4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-4))
- [Munin II QTV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2083469) - Test of the Munin II testing vehicle. (see: [Little Joe II QTV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Joe_II_Qualification_Test_Vehicle))
- [Pad Abort Test 1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2085018) - Can the LES pull the CM away from a exploding rocket at the pad?(see: [Pad Abort Test 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pad_Abort_Test_1))
- [Sleipnir I OS-5](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2086346) - The first test of a two stage Sleipnir I rocket (see: [Saturn I SA-5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-5))
- [O-001](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2086570) - Inflight LES test ontop of Munin II rocket (see: [A-001](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A-001))
- [SO-101](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2088218) - Putting a boilerplate CSM into orbit. (see: [AS-101](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-101_%28spacecraft%29))
- [SO-102](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2088823) - Another testrun of the Sleipnir I rocket with a boilerplate CSM. (see: [AS-102](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-102_%28spacecraft%29))
- [O-002](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2089798) - The second inflight test of the LES (see: [A-002](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A-002))
- [SO-103](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2090717) - Placing the Brisingamen 1 satellite into orbit, meassuring micrometeorite density (see: [AS-103](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-103_%28spacecraft%29))
- [O-003](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2092230) - The third and final inflight test of the LES (see: [A-003](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A-003))
- [SO-104](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2093049) - Launch of the Brisingamen 2 satellite. First nighttime launch of the Odin program (see: [AS-104](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-104_%28spacecraft%29))
- [Pad Abort Test 2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2094770) - The second pad abort test with a improves LES (see: [Pad Abort Test 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pad_Abort_Test_2))
- [SO-105](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2095749) - The third and final launch of a Brisingamen satellite (see: [AS-105](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-105_%28spacecraft%29))
- [SO-201](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2097885) - The first test of a fully functional CSM, ballistic trajectory (see: [AS-201](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-201))
- [Seer 1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2098605) - First soft landing probe on the Mun (see: [Surveyor 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_1))
- [SO-203](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2101102) - Extensive in orbit test of the S-IVB stage (see: [AS-203](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-203))
- [SO-202](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2103250) - The second test of a fully funtional CSM on a ballistic trajectory (see: [AS-202](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-202))
- [Seer 2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2106532) - The second munar probe of the Seer series (see: [Surveyor 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_2))
- [Odin I](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2106962) - The death of Jebediah Kerman (see: [Apollo 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_1))
- [Seer 3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2107564) - Third munar probe. Touchdown in a Midland Crater (see: [Surveyor 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_3))
- [Seer 4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2109860) - The fourth Seer probe. Touchdown in the Northern Basin (see: [Surveyor 4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_4))
- [Seer 5](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2112224) - The fifth Seer probe. Touchdown in the Southwest Crater (see: [Surveyor 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_5))
- [Seer 6](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2113983) - Penultimate Seer probe. Touchdown in the munar Midlands. (see: [Surveyor 6](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_6))
- [Odin IV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2118896) - The first, unmanned test flight of the Sleipnir V booster (see:[Apollo 4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_4))
- [Seer 7](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2120934) - The final Seer probe. Touchdown in the Munar Highlands. (see: [Surveyor 7](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_7))
- [Odin V](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2121547) - Orbital test of the Odin Munar Excursion Module (see:[Apollo 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_5))
- [Odin VI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2124755) - Final unkerballed test of the Sleipnir V booster (see:[Apollo 6](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_6))
- [Odin VII](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2127651) - Eleven days is orbit, first kerballed Odin mission (see:[Apollo 7](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_7))
- [Odin VIII](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2131147) - The first kerballed circummunar flight (see:[Apollo 8](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_8))
- [Odin IX](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2134827) - Kerballed test of the MEM and CSM in low kerbin orbit (see:[Apollo 9](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_9))
- [Odin X](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2139362) - The dress rehearsal (see:[Apollo 10](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_10))
- [Odin XI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2142432) - The first Kerbal on the Mun (see:[Apollo 11](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_11))
- [Odin XII](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2146754) - Precision landing near the Seer III probe (see:[Apollo 12](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_12))
- [Odin XIII](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2155707) - A successful failure (see:[Apollo 13](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_13))
- [Odin XIV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2163552) - The third munar landing and final "H" type mission (see:[Apollo 14](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_14))
- [Odin XV](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2170732) - A extended stay on the Mun [P1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2170732) [P2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2172393) [P3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2175674) (see:[Apollo 15](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_15))
- [Odin XVI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2190796) - A trip to the Hilbert highlands [P1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2190796) [P2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2193819) [P3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2198450) (see:[Apollo 16](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_16))
- [Odin XVII](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2211092) - Visiting the Litwack valley, last "J"-type mission [P1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2211092) [P2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2217416) [P3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2219027) (see:[Apollo 17](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_17))
- [AG-1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2221190) - Launch of the Asgard space station (see: [Skylab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skylab))
- [AG-2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2221858) - The first manned mission to the Asgard station (see: [Skylab 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skylab_2))
- [AG-3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2225658) - The second manned mission to the Asgard station (see: [Skylab 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skylab_3))
- [AG-4](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2231450) - The third mission to Asgard, last mission of Phase 1(see: [Skylab 4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skylab_4))
- [OZTP](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2249585) - The Odin Zhar-Ptitsa Test Project (see: [ASTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo%C3%83%C2%A2%C3%A2%E2%80%9A%C2%AC%C3%A2%E2%82%AC%C5%93Soyuz_Test_Project))
- ~~~~~Reality ends here~~~~~
- [Odin 18](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2253685) - A survey of Kerbin from a polar orbit
- [Odin 19](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2257712) - A complete survey of the Mun, the first all-female mission of the program
- [Bifrost](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2264259) - A system of four communication satellites in munar orbit
- [Odin 20](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2322514) - Return to Mun. First trip to it's far side. [P0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-hurricane-cleanup-efforts/&do=findComment&comment=2322514) [P1](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116561-odin-munar-progam-odin-20-preview/&do=findComment&comment=2322961)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-15T00:58:00Z" title="12/15/2015 12:58  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 15, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**
How many engines has your little rocket? Seems like you're overdoing it.

It is something of a S-IB rebuild, the first stage of the Saturn IB rocket.

![Saturn_IB_1st_stage.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f6/Saturn_IB_1st_stage.jpg)

So it has eight engines, just like the original. The thrust is a little lackluster, but I found no better solution.

Time for the first mission of the Odin programm: [Sleipnir I OS-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-1)

The second stage of the Sleipnir IB has been replaced with a dummy stage, this flight will only test the S-I stage.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/WhMAW/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
> 

The test was a full success - the engines fired for 2 minutes and 32 second and propelled the second stage to a 121.9 km apoapsis.

Apart from a single nosecone the rocket burned up completely during reentry.

* * *

The second mission: [Sleipnir I OS-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-2)

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/GrL6C/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
> 

The second test of the S-IB first stage was another complete success. The rocket flew a more realistic trjactory, putting the apoapsis right above the atmosphere and accelerating the second stage to 1427 m/s. The second stage burned up completely except for a nosecone.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T10:52:18Z" title="11/30/2015 10:52  AM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

> 
> 
> Transscript of the Mission Planning Committee said:
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "What about that Nosecone?"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Bill K.:** "We just found it - it's still useable. A few scratches here and there..."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "Well, just mount it ontop of the next rocket"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> *\*Wernher von Kerman enters the room\**
> 
> 
> 
>

**This Week:** Another *important* test of the Sleipnir IB rocket! This afternoon the third mission of the Odin Munar Program launched: [Sleipnir I OS-3](Saturn)

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/UcDrJ/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
> 

The new test flight found that, if launched vertically, the S-IB stage can lift the dummy second stage to a hight of 162.65 km. Another step closer to the Mun!

This morning the fourth mission of the Odin program launched: [Sleipnir I OS-4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn_I_SA-4)

OS-4 will be the last single stage test of the new Sleipnir Rocket. As the first three missions it will be a suborbital flight.

The major addition to this flight is that, in order to test the rocket's ability to deal with an engine failure during the flight, one of the engines will be dropped once the rocket reaches Mach 2. To the astonishment of the engineers the rocket was able to compensate the lost engine and deliver the second stage to a 91 km apoapsis.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/T3KuG/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
> 

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T11:46:42Z" title="11/30/2015 11:46  AM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

This week in the Odin Munar Program: [Munin II QTV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Joe_II_Qualification_Test_Vehicle)

The Munin II vehicle was built specifically as a cheap way to test the new launch escape system. Todays flight objectives were to prove the Munin II rocket's capability as an Odin CSM test vehicle and to determine maximum speed of the plywood-contraption.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/rZSkO/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
>

The rocket reached its maximum speed of 439.4 m/s (or Mach 1.48) at an altitude of 11.4 km. It reached an 18.5 km apogee before plumeting back into the ocean. No nosecones where hurt in the process.

This morning the Pad Abort Test 1 took place at the Kerbal Space Center. The launch escape system (LES) had to proof that it is capable of pulling the command module away from a possibly exploding rocket while it sat on the pad. The LES then had to gain enough altitude to allow the command module's parachutes to open. Officials that witnessed the Test were highly impressed!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:28:07Z" title="11/30/2015 04:28  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

This morning the fifth test of the Sleipnir I rocket took place at the KSC: [Sleipnir I OS-5](Saturn)

For the first time the Sleipnir I would fly two stages, the eight engine S-I first and the six engine S-IV second stage. This is the first orbital mission of the Odiun Munar Program, with the final stage entering a highly elliptical 90.2 km x 8750 km orbit around kerbin, turning the S-IV Stage into the heaviest satellite to ever be accelerated into space.

In it's second test, the LES hat to pull a dummy CM away from a transsonic Munin II rocket. Once again the LES performed it's mission admirably and at Mach 1.2 pulled the CM away from the Munin II rocket and into safety.

This afternoon the Odin Launch Escape System had to prove itself once again! In the [O-002 Mission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A-002)!

A upgraded Munin II missile accelerated the command module to incredible Mach 2 before the LES fired and pulled the CM away from the rocket to safety.

Once again the test was a complete success!

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/0x1EX/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:31:09Z" title="11/30/2015 04:31  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

The Sleipnir I one stands on its pad, poised to fullfill the[SO-103 Mission](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-103_%28spacecraft%29): to send the [Brinsingamen 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pegasus_%28satellite%29) satellite into orbit. The world largest rocket shakes the ground as it as it generates its 1477.68 kilonewtons of thrust. When the satellite is in place it goes into action on its own to thrust out large, winglike panels. These will measure the damage tiny meteorites might cause as they hit a spacecraft with sandblast effect, while they speed through the reaches of outer space!

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/zHd7D/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:31:34Z" title="11/30/2015 04:31  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**
Great Ker-Pegasus Launch. I always thought the idea of the payload fairing being shaped like the CSM was a fun idea.

In the original mission the satellite was behind a boilerplate command module. As far as I could find out, the satellite was basically stuffed into a service module mock-up. 

I made a small mistake in using the LES to seperate the CM and the satellite. Seems like one of the original mission objectives was to test the LES/CM separation in a normal flight, aswell as testing Command Module/Service Module separation. They basically did some equipment testing while deploying the satellite.

This is the last time the LES has to proof itself in flight: The [O-003](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A-003) Mission!

The rocket started to roll shortly after launch, but continued to accelerate to Mach 1.4. At supersonic speeds, the command module was once again pulled into safety by the LES and shortly after spashed down safely in the KSC bay. Engineers are now convinced that the Kerbonauts can be pulled into safety, should anything go wrong during launch.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/Vmymr/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:34:06Z" title="11/30/2015 04:34  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

The first flight of the mighty Sleipnir IB: [SO-201](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-201)

Today the first fully functional Command and Service module was put through its paces together with the improved Sleipnir IB booster. After liftoff the rocket headed down the missile range east-by-south on a high ballistic trajectory. The first stage worked flawlessly, after lifting the rocket to a hight of 22 km the S-IVB took over and boosted the craft to an 183km apoapsis. Once the second stage was spent, the CSM fired its engines twice. This proved that the engine could restart in space, a crucial part of any manned flight to the Mun.

The Capsule reentered the atmosphere shotly thereafter, splashing down in the ocean mere 14 minutes and 43 seconds after liftoff - 600 km away from its launchpad.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/hgwzX/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:34:33Z" title="11/30/2015 04:34  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

We have just procured our newest rocket: the [Naglfar-Logi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atlas-Centaur)

![wrFk8RL.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/wrFk8RL.png?1)

The first stage of this new rocket is a modification of the old [Naglfar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SM-65_Atlas) ICBM. However, this old workhorse will from now on pull the chariot of science! Outfittet with the new Logi Second stage it becomes a top of the line two-and-a-half stages expendable launch system, that can be used to send satellites into orbit or probes to the mun.

> 
> 
> In a KSC meeting room said:
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "Ah, Wernher - things are getting interesting now, don't they? With the Sleipnir IB and all."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Wernher von K.:** "Yes, zey surely have, Gene."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "You seem to be at the KSC all the time these days, Wernher - you should take some time for yourself. You know - a hobby."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Wernher von K.:** "A hobby?"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "Yeah - you know, get some quality time. Relax."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Wernher von K.:** "Ah, Gene, you are looking after me. But don't vorry, I allready have a hobby."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "You do?"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Wernher von K.:** "Yes, I build probes ve can send to ze Mun before ve send any kerbals."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "What?"
> 

Today the first Naglfar-Logi rocket launched from the KSC to bring a unmanned probe to the Mun. The mission proceeded flawlessly, flying to the Mun nonstop, without any parking orbits. The probe showed that a powered, soft landing on the Mun is possible. It will remain on the ground near the edge of the huge Northwest Crater on the Mun. A monument to kerbal ingenuity.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/pfpRZ/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:35:41Z" title="11/30/2015 04:35  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

> 
> 
> In Wernhers office said:
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "Ah..Wernher....it's seems like there is problem with the CSM"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Wernher von K.:** "A problem?"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "Yes....the workers seem to be on a strike.."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Wernher von K.:** "A strike? Zis is ze munar program! How can zey strike? Zis is important!"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** "They...didn't get any snacks in the last month"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Wernher von K.:** "oh....OH.......vell....in zis case. Ve vill postpone ze SO-202 mission. Ze next flight will be ze SO-203 launch."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Gene K.:** \*sighs and steps over to the window\* "Guys! Yes! Pull out the other rocket! Yeah! No! The 203!"
> 

Today the [SO-203](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-203) mission launched from the KSC. It carried no Odin Command/Service Module spacecraft, as its purpose was to verify the design of the S-IVB rocket stage restart capability that would later be used in the Odin program to boost kerbonauts from Kerbin orbit to a trajectory towards the Mun.

Six minutes and twenty seconds after launch the second stage entered a circular orbit around kerbin, where it performed numerous test and experiments.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/yNo9A/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:36:20Z" title="11/30/2015 04:36  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**

[SO-202](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AS-202) - the second unkerballed, suborbital test flight of a fully funtiontional Odin CSM, launched with the Sleipnir IB launch vehicle.

This mission was postponed after some problems at the plant of the Odin CSM manufacturer. But this morning the Sleipnir IB cleared the pad an carried the Odin CSM on a suborbital trajectory into space.

At the 2 minute, 10 second mark the first stage seperated, retro und ullage engines firing. The improved S-IVB stage carried the craft to a 260km apoapsis. All stages of the rocket worked flawlessly.

Once in space, the CSM activated its engine an fired it repeatedly to test the engine and its refire-ability. The RCS was also activated and thoroughly tested. This was the first time the CSM relied on its fuel cells during flight. 17 Minutes, 37 seconds into the flight the spacecraft neared the Kerbin atmosphere again, so the service module is seperated and the reentry procedure started. The capsuled entered at a rather steep angle, testing the heat shield for future high speed reentries from transmunar trajectories.

The parachutes deployed as planned an the capsule splashed down 20 minutes and 48 seconds after launch, south-east of the [Ubacia island](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71685-Most-Detailed-Kerbal-Border-Map-in-History).

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/X6Yn5/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

> 
> 
>  
>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-30T16:38:06Z" title="11/30/2015 04:38  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 30, 2015</time> by Xeldrak**
